column4: Welcome, you are now talking to an AI doctor. As I am part of a scientific experiment, I would appreciate it if you could take the time to answer a super short questionnaire at the end of the interview. Tap Speak to ask your question and then tap Send to submit it to me.
I have back pain. What can I do?

It is important to take note of what type of back pain you experience and when it usually occurs. If the pain is mild, then you may try some simple lifestyle changes such as getting more exercise or sleeping in a better position. Ibuprofen or acetaminophen may help reduce pain as well. However, if the pain is severe or persistent, then it would be best to consult your doctor for further evaluation.
What can I do when my doctor gives me bad advice?

It is important to have trust and confidence in your doctor, but it is also important to take ownership of your health. If you have any doubts or questions about the advice that your doctor has given you, it is best to notify your doctor and discuss the issue with them. If you feel that the advice is incorrect or not in alignment with your values or beliefs, it may be helpful to seek a second opinion from another doctor.
I'm sorry, I don't understand the question. Could you please elaborate more?
What can I do against dandruff?

Dandruff can be caused by a variety of factors, including dry skin, not shampooing often enough, and sensitivity to certain products. To help reduce dandruff, it is important to shampoo regularly using an anti-dandruff shampoo, to use a mild cleanser, and to keep your scalp hydrated by using a moisturizing oil or cream. Additionally, it may be helpful to reduce stress levels, eat a nutritious diet, and use a humidifier in the area. If the symptoms persist, it is best to consult your doctor.
